recipetext: Cook spaghetti according to package directions.
Cook pancetta in a large skillet until crispy.
Whisk eggs and parmesan cheese in a bowl.
Drain spaghetti and add to skillet with pancetta.
Remove skillet from heat and add egg mixture, tossing quickly to avoid scrambling the eggs.
6. Serve immediately.

ingAmount: 1 lb boneless skinless chicken breasts cut into strips
recipetext: Cook fettuccine according to package directions.
Cook chicken in a large skillet until no longer pink.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add heavy cream and parmesan cheese and cook until thickened.
Drain fettuccine and add to skillet with sauce. 6. Serve immediately.

ingAmount: 1 lb boneless skinless chicken breasts cut into strips
2 eggs, beaten 1 cup panko bread crumbs
recipetext: Cook spaghetti according to package directions.
Dip chicken strips in flour, then egg, then bread crumbs.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken strips and cook until golden brown.
Remove chicken from skillet and drain on paper towels.
Add spaghetti to skillet and toss with chicken.
Sprinkle with mozzarella and parmesan cheese.
Serve immediately.

ingAmount: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into strips
recipetext: Dip chicken strips in flour, then egg, then bread crumbs.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken strips and cook until golden brown.
Remove chicken from skillet and drain on paper towels.
Place a slice of ham and a slice of swiss cheese on each chicken strip.
Roll up chicken and secure with toothpicks.
Return chicken to skillet and cook until cheese is melted.
Serve immediately.
Cook pasta according to package directions.
In a food processor, combine basil, parmesan cheese, pine nuts, and garlic.
Pulse until ingredients are finely chopped.
Gradually add olive oil and continue pulsing until a paste is formed.
Drain pasta and toss with pesto sauce.
Serve immediately.

ingAmount: 2 tbsp oil, 2 large leeks thinly sliced
100g peppered smoked mackerel with skin removed
recipetext: Put the potatoes in a microwaveable bowl with some water, cover, then cook for 5 mins until tender.
Heat the oil in a frying pan, add the leeks with a pinch of salt and cook for 10 mins, stirring until softened.
Tip in the potatoes, turn up the heat and fry for a couple of mins to crisp.
Flake through the mackerel.
Make four indents in the leek mixture in the pan, crack an egg into each, season, then cover the pan and cook for 6-8 mins until the whites have set and the yolks are runny.
Serve immediately.
Cook the gnocchi in a pan of lightly salted, boiling water.
Drain and reserve 200ml of the cooking water.
Heat the butter in a frying pan.
Add the gnocchi, cheese and pepper as well as 150ml of the cooking water, raise the heat a little and stir until melted and the gnocchi is well coated.
Season with salt.
Transfer the gnocchi to bowls and serve.

ingAmount: 6 lightly smoked raw salmon fillets with skin removed
recipetext: Put the spinach in a saucepan and add a few tablespoons of water.
Cover, set over a medium heat and cook for 5-8 mins, turning the spinach over occasionally until wilted.
Tip it into a colander to drain and allow it to cool.
Take handfuls of it and squeeze out excess water.
Chop the spinach, melt the butter in a saucepan and toss the spinach in it.
Season with pepper and salt.
Heat the oven to 140C, lay the spinach in the bottom of a gratin dish, then arrange the salmon fillets on top.
Heat the double cream in a pan, then pour it over the salmon and spinach.
Bake for 35 mins, or until the top is golden and the cream is bubbling.
Serve immediately.
Thoroughly chop the roasted red pepper with the olive oil, walnuts and garlic in a food processor, season well and set aside.
Heat a pan of salted water to boil, add the pasta and cook for 1 min less than the pack instructions and drain, reserving a ladleful of cooking water.
Tip the pasta back into the pan, along with the reserved cooking water and red pepper sauce, and return to the heat to warm through.
Tip the pasta into a bowl and top with the parmesan and some chopped toasted walnuts.
Season and serve.
Spread some butter on top of each slice of bread, place the ham and cheese on a slice of bread and then top with the other bread slice.
Melt the remaining butter in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Place the sandwich in the skillet and let it cook, flipping once, until golden brown, about 3 minutes per side.
Serve immediately.
1. Place a pot over medium heat and melt the butter, add onion and tomatoes.
2. Bring to a low simmer, add some salt and leave and cook for about 40 minutes.
3. Blend and serve.
Lightly beat the eggs with salt and pepper in a bowl.
Melt 1 tablespoon of the butter in a skillet over low heat; swirl to coat the bottom and sides.
Cook the eggs until most of the liquid has thickened and the eggs are soft, about 10 minutes.
Remove and add the last tablespoon of butter.
Serve.
Peel and grate the potatoes, then squeeze out excess moisture.
Heat 3 tablespoons of oil in a frying pan, add the potatoes and spread them out evenly along the bottom of the pan.
After a few minutes, flip the hash browns.
Continue to cook until both sides are golden brown.
Serve immediately.
Bring a pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
Cook elbow macaroni in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, 8 minutes.
Melt butter in a saucepan.
Add flour, salt, and pepper and stir until smooth, about 5 minutes.
Pour in milk while stirring, continue to cook and stir until mixture is smooth and bubbling, about 5 minutes, making sure the milk doesn't burn.
Add cheddar cheese and stir until melted, 2-4 minutes.
Drain macaroni and fold into cheese sauce until coated.
Serve immediately.

ingAmount: 1 lb beef sirloin, cut into thin strips
recipetext: Cook egg noodles according to package directions.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add beef strips and cook until browned.
Add onion and garlic and cook until softened.
Sprinkle flour over the mixture and stir to combine.
Add beef broth and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer until sauce thickens.
Remove from heat and stir in sour cream.
Drain noodles and serve with beef stroganoff sauce.
